comments.commentBody:
A classic Yankee game. Excellent performance by Hughes, Robertson nicely bailed out Wood and Mariano came in to shut the door!

And the offense was similarly productive with a well-rounded performance from the veterans like Jorge, the rising stars like Swisher and Grandy. And congrats to Thames -- looks like his second stint in The Bronx may be a long one.

Now it's on the the ALCS. Looks like Texas unless the Rays pull a rabbit -- either way the Yanks will be well-rested for Round 2.
Wow.  Won one without needing the umps.  Go Texas!  It's that time of year when the big-money boys go home.

comments.userLocation: Lewis Family Farm, Essex, New York
comments.commentBody: The Yanks wanted the Twins.

Yankees made it look easy.

Workmanlike and professional. Been there, done that.

Texas/Tampa Bay - neither has a chance. Next.

The Yankees are amazing after choking in September and finding themselves 1 game behind the Rays at the end of the season.  Joe Giradri and the entire team are fantastic.  They look like the New York Yankees who will be at their best for Texas or Tampa Bay this Friday.  GOooooooooYANKEES.  Michael Zullo, Upper Eastside, Manhattan

Apparently, MachoMenos has got tickets to the upcoming SuperBowl in Dallas.  That's the only way anyone associated with the Chargers is going to be at the game - although A.J. Smith a.k.a. the Lord of No Rings, may be there for league meetings - but certainly not a Chargers' game.

The chickens are coming home to roost after all the efforts of the Republican administration to undermine the power of the three branches of government.  Now it is glaringly evident (more evident) that some of the justices on the Supreme Court are there only to serve the agenda of the party that got them the job in the first place, and sadly Bush could have appointed another conservative with at least half a brain. As far as the funding for Mrs.  Thomas's 501(c)(3), I get a knee jerk reaction that it is that pesky family from Kansas again that got so rich on refining oil and polluting the environment, that is clandestinely providing the funding.  I'd rate them on the same level as Al Queda,may-be worse, when it comes to preserving shreds of "American democracy".

A skinny, raggedy 19 year-old in a five-buck Santa costume rides around Franklin Field in front of 54,000 Eagles fans who braved a snowstorm to support their 1968 team that finished 2-12. Santa himself, Frank Olivo, considered the incident a harmless joke and states he was just a substitute for inept ownership that would not reach a Superbowl for another 12 years and still has never won the Big Game.
Yet this bromide persists because Howard Cosell reported it that night on his sports news segment. I've seen and heard this same insult dozens of times.
Philly fans are no longer bothered; we know bad teams when see them; we also recognize lazy journalists, too.
Part 2 of the overworked national indictment insists that Eagles fans booed Donavan McNabb when he was drafted. Literally "Dirty Thirty" nitwits, led by a jackass sports radio host (graduate of Columbia Journalism), egged on by Mayor now Comcast Governtator Ed Rendell, wanted Wacky Weed Rickey Williams with the first pick.
Donovan McNabb was not booed then, and never was booed in all his 1-5 NFC Championship Game years. MacNabb would be been only 1-4, but, in 2004, Favre threw a wounded duck into double coverage from his own end zone, which Brian Dawkins intercepted and David Akers put through the goalpost three plays later.
Favre's high stature among pundits, in spite of his once-again killer mistake against New Orleans last season, is inversely proportional to the negative, old and tired boilerplate description of Eagles fans.

Yankees are Goldman-Sachs? Nah.

Goldman-Sachs dreams of being the New York Yankees.

Bogus: envy is ugly!!

I used to like this place. A nice place in Homer. Ak of all places. I just endured the WORST sitution at the bar at this place. The bar waitress TOTALLY ignored me for 2 hours plus. This is the worst service experiment I have endured in years. I wouldn't go there if I was starving. Think twice about going there to give them business. AND they won't give out their WiFi code either so it's not computer friendly. Stay Away!!!!
If more democratic candidates and the administration listened to Nancy , we would gain democratic seats this election in both the House and Senate. Keep blasting them Nancy,

GO NANCY. ..And just remember to ratify HCR so that we can have the public option. Because  the bill is not covering nearly as many people as it should. While trying to please the Republican /Tea party,  who didn't vote for it anyway , it kinda stinks... but we 'd rather have you than the BaJa Beach tan man.

Some day the media folks will learn to ignore party hack vilification and write articles about what Ms Pelosi or other politicians actually do each day and what they do not do. There is no good reason to amplify personal attacks what ever the content.

Some day, some day, I dream for it.
Pelosi lied, jobs died.

Ah, yes, Nancy Pelosi, that economic "genius" who pontificated this past week that food stamps and unemployment benefits are the best ways to help grow the economy.

Since "Recovery Summer" proved to be a bust, Pelosi is now touting the "entitlement express" as the vehicle of economic success.

At least Pelosi's new tactic is a creative departure from blaming Bush, Boehner, the obstructionist Republicans, FOX, the Tea Party, Palin, Limbaugh, and Murdoch.

37.
InvokingDiotima
Sebastopol writes:
"The corporate masters of the universe, their Republican lackeys, media carnival barkers and rag-tag tea-baggers ...hate and fear Nancy Pelosi because she is effective ... It's that simple"

Yes, but you forgot to include the American people. We also hate and fear her because she is effective - effective in destroying the economy, our jobs, and our spirit. She is effective in putting more and more people on food stamps and below the poverty line.

It is legitimate to hate and fear someone who can do that.

only california would approve of someone like her being a representative. is there any way we can have that state removed from our confederacy? they wouldn't survive five minutes having to live on their own.

I'm an absentee voter from Pelosi's district. Though I have voted for Democrats in the past (Clinton once, Gavin Newsom once, etc.) I would never and have never voted for the career opportunist currently running the House.

In the end, her staunchest supporters have to face the fact that even with The One running the Executive Branch, Pelosi's extreme left-bent received not a day longer in power than that other kind of extremist, Newt Gingrich. Both held sway for exactly four years and not a day more. Americans who actually have things to lose (family, home, assets, etc.) continue to prefer the cool, comfortable middle of the political candle to its bright, burning-hot ends.

It's tough to be a democrat these days because there is not a propaganda outlet out there which would hammer the message, wheter true or false, as the rush/fNC group does 7/24. Nothing on the left does even come close to that, the verocity, hateful energy, complete lack of regard for the truth, is just unmatched.

For now, propaganda is winning! Give it another 2-3 years folks, and there won't be any way to come back!
Where can I go to find out why Pelosi is so unpopular?  I thought winners were cut some slack by their crew.  Has she personally offended fellow Democrats?

I could not stand George Bush and I can't stand Barack Obama. (I voted for Obama, but he was a poseur as it turns out.) I can't stand Nancy Pelosi and I really don't like John Boehner.

I DO like Jim Webb, so I am capable of liking a politician. Am I the only one out there that thinks "a pox on both their houses!"

The voters will decide if Pelosi has been effective.

Don't assume that most Republicans want John Boehner to lead the Republican Party as Speaker. Many do not. He is the same type of career politician as Pelosi. Time for the term limits discussion again.
@ B.Mull #1 who wrote: "Pelosi's not perfect but she generally looks out for the middle class and the poor," makes me cringe, yell, break the computer and give up on this nation forever.
She is the All American "Iron Lady" and it will be the beginning of the end for the US if the GOP can fool the US electorate once again and win a majority in Congress.

Compared to Newt who shut down the government and went toe to toe with Clinton and lost, Nancy is my kind of gal who stands up to the special interests and fat cats and is looking out for the best interests of all the people in the good ol' USA.
I'm a good ol' boy, but I'm sticking with Nancy in this fight.
